intro: Arenaria sperguloides, commonly known as sand sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It typically forms dense mats of small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, thriving in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in tundra and mountainous areas where temperatures are cold and conditions are extreme. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems.
